Paragraph: To measure the field effect mobility of the charge carriers , OTFT were fabricated on a silicon wafer using a bottom contact geometry ( channel length L = 12 μm , and width , W = 120 μm ) under nitrogen.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: To measure the field effect mobility of the charge carriers , OTFT were fabricated on a silicon wafer using a bottom contact geometry ( channel length L = 12 μm , and width , W = 120 μm ) under nitrogen.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value          |
|-----------------------|
| field effect mobility  |
| OTFT                  |
| silicon wafer         |
| bottom contact geometry|
| channel length L       |
| and width W            |
| nitrogen              |
| channel length L = 12 μm|
| width W = 120 μm       |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value          |
|-----------------------|
| field effect mobility  |
| OTFT                  |
| channel length L       |
| width W               |
| nitrogen concentration |

Explanation:

* "To measure the field effect mobility of the charge carriers" refers to the property "field effect mobility".
* "OTFT were fabricated on a silicon wafer" refers to the device "OTFT".
* "using a bottom contact geometry" is a fabrication method and does not refer to a material property.
* "channel length L = 12 μm" and "width W = 120 μm" refer to the material properties "channel length" and "width" respectively.
* "under nitrogen" refers to the environment in which the fabrication was carried out. "Nitrogen" is the material property that describes this environment.
